Uses of Package
org.apache.lucene.spatial.spatial4j.geo3d

  • Packages that use org.apache.lucene.spatial.spatial4j.geo3d 
    Package Description
    org.apache.lucene.spatial.spatial4j
    Spatial4j stuff that ideally belongs in Spatial4j (isn't related to Lucene).
    org.apache.lucene.spatial.spatial4j.geo3d
    Shapes implemented using 3D planar geometry.
  • Classes in org.apache.lucene.spatial.spatial4j.geo3d used by org.apache.lucene.spatial.spatial4j 
    Class and Description
    GeoShape
    Generic shape.
  • Classes in org.apache.lucene.spatial.spatial4j.geo3d used by org.apache.lucene.spatial.spatial4j.geo3d 
    Class and Description
    Bounds
    An object for accumulating bounds information.
    GeoArea
    A GeoArea represents a standard 2-D breakdown of a part of sphere.
    GeoBaseExtendedShape
    Base extended shape object.
    GeoBBox
    All bounding box shapes have this interface in common.
    GeoBBoxBase
    All bounding box shapes can derive from this base class, which furnishes some common code
    GeoDistance
    Generic geo-distance-capable shape class description.
    GeoDistanceShape
    Distance shapes have capabilities of both geohashing and distance computation (which also includes point membership determination).
    GeoMembershipShape
    Membership shapes have capabilities of both geohashing and membership determination.
    GeoPath.PathSegment
    This is the precalculated data for a path segment.
    GeoPath.SegmentEndpoint
    This is precalculated data for segment endpoint.
    GeoPoint
    This class represents a point on the surface of a unit sphere.
    GeoShape
    Generic shape.
    GeoSizeable
    Some shapes can compute radii of a geocircle in which they are inscribed.
    GeoWideDegenerateHorizontalLine.EitherBound 
    GeoWideNorthRectangle.EitherBound 
    GeoWideRectangle.EitherBound 
    GeoWideSouthRectangle.EitherBound 
    Membership
    Interface describing 3d shape membership methods.
    Plane
    We know about three kinds of planes.
    SidedPlane
    Combination of a plane, and a sign value indicating what evaluation values are on the correct side of the plane.
    Vector
    A 3d vector in space, not necessarily going through the origin.
